intro: Senecio ciliatus, commonly known as the velvetleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features alternate, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive velvety texture and soft, fuzzy appearance. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in a cluster at the ends of the stems. Senecio ciliatus is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
